thread.title: The 'This Is Us' Finale Is Going To Destroy Us All
thread.title_full: The 'This Is Us' Finale Is Going To Destroy Us All

title: The 'This Is Us' Finale Is Going To Destroy Us All
text:
The 'This Is Us' Finale Is Going To Destroy Us All 
Creator Dan Fogelman calls it "the darkest place we've been." NBC By Emma Dibdin Mar 7, 2017 The This Is Us finale airs a week from tonight, and you'd better start preparing. According to show creator Dan Fogelman, season one's final episode is going to be its most devastating yet. The finale is "definitely the darkest place we've been," Fogelman told Variety , describing the episode as "incredibly ambitious" in the way it jumps between time periods. "There is a scene with Milo [Ventimiglia] and Mandy [Moore] that I have not seen on television. I think it's going to rock people." Considering the brutal fight their characters Jack and Rebecca had last time we saw them on screen together—a fight that may well take place shortly before Jack's still-mysterious death—this does not bode well. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below "We're going to destroy America by the end of the season," Moore promised. "As if they don't have enough to be upset about at this point in time anyway...but they're going to be upset for a completely different set of reasons." Not ready. Never gonna be ready. This Is Us airs Tuesdays at 9/8c on NBC. More from ELLE:
